column5: I've been trying to find flourescent monofilament but no stores seem to have it. The one I need to replace is lime green. I used this line for fishing below the lights on dams and it worked great for visibility. Most of the lines I have seen are clear although they advertise as clear/blue. I always used Stren or Trilene, maybe they don't make it anymore? Thanks
Maxima Ultra Green comes in a really bright green colour.  Might wanna check it out.
Thanks, Don't necessarily need green but will check it out, appreciate it.
Original Stren glows bluish and I believe that it is still sold.
Cabelas pro line comes in hi vis yellow. Great line and cheap too.
Ande line has hi via yellow...
Raven Line. Sold at any Sail store and most other big box tackle shops.

I don't get it.? Why would you want a line so visible?  In my little mind if I can see it then the fish can as well? (leaders well choose what you like) I use my rod and line along with the lure/bait to tell me whats going on under water..  Don.
I use hi vis line for vertical jigging... Helps me see my line to stay as vertical as possible...
i use Cajun red i get it i the states and from time to time you see it in Candace love the stuff for steelies in cold water . its a dark red almost burgundy color.  doesnt hurt my  production at all
